bibl.title: George Hawkins v. The United States of America. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court for the Districk of Alaska, Division 2

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF ALASKA, Second Division.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, Plaintiff, -vs.- GEORGE HAWKINS, Defendant.
div1.p: Now, at this time, October 14th, 1902, at a regular term of the above entitled court held at Nome in the Second Division, District of Alaska, this cause coming on to be heard upon the motion of James E. Fenton, counsel for the above named defendant, for an order of this court admitting the said defendant to bail in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00), UNITED STATES OF AMERICA appearing by Melvin Grigsby, United States District Attorney in and for said District and Division, and John L. McGinn, Assistant United States District Attorney for said District and Division, and it appearing to the court from the records and proceedings in the above entitled cause, that the said defendant was tried and convicted in the above entitled court upon the charge of robbery, and on the 22nd day of March, 1901, by judgment of the above entitled court sentenced to be confined in the United States penitentiary at McNeill's Island in the State of Washington for the period of fifteen (15) years; and that thereafter, such proceedings were had and taken in the above entitled cause that the said defendant prosecuted a writ of error from the said judgment to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals in and for the Ninth Circuit; and that thereafter, such proceedings were had and taken in the said United States Circuit Court of Appeals that the said judgment of conviction was reversed and the said defendant granted a new trial; and it further appearing to the court

that the said defendant is now confined in the said United States penitentiary at McNeill's Island in the State of Washingtion upon the said charge, and that the said defendant should be admitted to bail;

NOW THEREFORE, it is ordered and adjudged that the application of the said defendant to be admited to bail in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) be and the same is hereby denied, to which ruling of the court the defendant excepted and an exception is allowed.
AND IT IS FURTHER ORDERED AND ADJUDGED that the said defendant be and he is hereby admitted to bail in the sum of THREE THOUSAND DOLLARS ($3,000.00).

And the said defendant appearing by his attorney James E. Fenton, at the same time, and having moved his court for an order that the suretires upon said bail be allowed to appear and qualify before and that the said bail be approved by the Honorable C.S.Hanford, Judge of the United States District Court in and for the District of Washington, at Seattle, in the State of Washington, and the United States District Attorney in and for the District of Alaska, Second Division, and JOhn L. McGinn, Assistant District Attorney, appearing and resisting the said motion, and it appearing to the court that this court has no power or authority to make said order allowing the sureties upon said bail to appear and qualify before any one except the judge of this court; IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED AND ADJUDGED that the said application be and the same is hereby denied, to which ruling of the court the defendant excepted and an exception is allowed.
DONE IN OPEN COURT, this 14th day of October, A.D., 1902.
Filed in the Office of the Clerk of the U.S.Dist.Court? Alaska, Second Division, at Nome, Alaska, Oct14 1902. Geo.V. Borchsenius, Clerk. By H.A.Haagenson, Deputy Clerk.
